scenarioDescription:
The TOI-2257 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-2257 is a star with 0.33 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.31 times its radius. It is located 188.49 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-2257 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-2257 system


TOI-2257 b

TOI-2257 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-2257 b is 5.438 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-2257 b is 2.194 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-2257 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-2257, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-2257 - System With 1 Exoplanet
